meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dewy.
meanings.sent1: The dewinesses of the morning made the grass sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I love the dewinesses of early spring mornings.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome complained about the excessive dewinesses, saying it made his hat soggy.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings captured the delicate dewinesses of nature perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The dewinesses of the meadow created a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The presence of dew on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The farmer woke up to find the dewinesses on the leaves of his crops.
meanings.sent2: The dewinesses on the grass indicated a cool night.
meanings.sent3: The cat left paw prints in the dewinesses on the car windshield.
meanings.sent4: The dewinesses on the petals made the flowers look like they were covered in diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The early morning dewinesses glistened like tiny crystals in the sunlight.
